    • Method Detail

      • getPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_hideForRadiusGreaterThan

        public long getPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_hideForRadiusGreaterThan()

      • setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_hideForRadiusGreaterThan

        public void setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_hideForRadiusGreaterThan(long pointPOIsLevelOfDetail_hideForRadiusGreaterThan)
        This parameter controls if point POIs should be hidden if current map radius is greater than given value. Can be set to null, meaning the point POIs are always visible. By default it's set to 50 to enable hiding of point POIs.

        Point POI - POIs without a room associated with it that appear as a single icon, such as ATMs, Escalators, Charging Stations, etc.

        Parameters:
        pointPOIsLevelOfDetail_hideForRadiusGreaterThan -

      • getPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius

        public long getPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius()

      • setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius

        public void setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius(long pointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius)
        This parameter controls whether point POIs should be scaled when the map radius changes.

        There are four relevant values: setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius(long) setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale(double) setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_toRadius(long) setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_toScale(double)

        This means that for map radius >= 40 the scale should be 1, between 40 and 15 the scale should be scaled linearly from 1 to 0.6 and below map radius 15, the scale should be 0.6 The above mentioned values are the defaults for this setting. It can be set to null, meaning the point POIs have always the scale = 1.

        Parameters:
        pointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius -

      • getPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale

        public double getPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale()

      • setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale

        public void setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale(double pointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale)
        This parameter controls whether point POIs should be scaled when the map radius changes.

        There are four relevant values: setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromRadius(long) setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale(double) setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_toRadius(long) setPointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_toScale(double)

        This means that for map radius >= 40 the scale should be 1, between 40 and 15 the scale should be scaled linearly from 1 to 0.6 and below map radius 15, the scale should be 0.6 The above mentioned values are the defaults for this setting. It can be set to null, meaning the point POIs have always the scale = 1.

        Parameters:
        pointPOIsLevelOfDetail_resize_fromScale -
